image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives, Gift of the U.S. Association of Former Members of Congress

profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born in Fargo, Cass County, N.Dak., February 8, 1930; graduated from Moorhead High School, Moorhead, Minn., 1948; farmer; member, Barnesville, Minn., school board, 1976-1977; member, Minnesota state house of representatives, 1966-1975; delegate, Minnesota state Republican conventions, 1964-1968; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-fifth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Robert Selmer Bergland, and reelected to the six succeeding Congresses (February 22, 1977-January 3, 1991); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Second Congress in 1990; was a resident of Barnesville, Minn.; died on July 2, 2013, in Detroit Lakes, Minn.

researchRecord.name: 1982-1988, 12 commercials on 4 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Arlan Stangeland's campaigns for the 1982, 1984 and 1988 U.S. congressional elections in District 7 of Minnesota, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1970-1991, 21.1 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The congressional papers of Congressman Arlan Stangeland include project files, legislative files, political and election files, biographical information, and similar material from the Moorhead, Minnesota office. The bulk of the collection relates to legislation affecting the seventh district, and to federally-supported projects within the district. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
